author: dgaudet
msg: It seems foolish to define SIGURG SIGUSR1 especially when SIGUSR1 is used
for graceful restarts.  Given that the only usage of SIGURG is now
protected by a #ifdef we don't really need the definition.  ... similarly
for BeOS, why define SIGBUS SIGSEGV?

author: dgaudet
msg: After a SIGHUP the listening sockets in the parent weren't
properly marked for closure on fork().

author: martin
msg: Add a preliminary EBCDIC porting paper (derived from README.EBCDIC)
